item.title: Superbowl Watch Party
item.description: Sunday, February 9, 2025 6:30 PM - 8:30 PM - Join us at the Chapel + Cultural Center for a Super Bowl Watch Party! Enjoy pizza, good company, and the big game on our large screen. Cheer for your team, watch the halftime show, and have a great time with friends. If you’re able, please bring a can of soup for our Super Bowl Soup Collection to support those in need. Kickoff is at 6:30pm, so come early to grab a seat and some food.

item.title: Tesla x RPI Application Workshop, Tech Talk, Networking to be Held February 19
item.description: Tesla will host a session that will provide guidance on the resume-building and application process to help RPI students stand out! Immediately following the Tech Talk, Tesla will transition to a networking event in the DCC Great Hall where students can speak to-one with engineering managers. Seating is limited, so be sure to register in Handshake!

item.title: New Apartment Search Site Launched
item.description: Date: Tuesday, January 28, 2025 - Wed , February 12, 2025 (all day) - The Off-Campus Commons would like to announce its new search platform, an enhanced site to help make your apartment search easier! Students who create an account for this new platform by Thursday, February 13 will be entered in a raffle.

item.title: Lean Green Belt Certification: February 21 - Febrary 23
item.description: Friday, February 21, 2025 4:00 PM - Sun , February 23, 2025 6:00 PM - The Industrial & Systems Engineering Dept. and IISE student chapter, along with Institute of Industrial and Systems Engineers (IISE) Headquarters, present a short course on Lean Green Belt. Taught by Dr. Asish Ghosh. Register by 2/7/2025 to receive a discounted rate. Last day to register for the course is 2/17/2025.

item.title: Info Session for Summer 2025 IBM Visiting Student Opportunities
item.description: Friday, February 7, 2025, 2:30 PM - 4:30 PM - The RPI-IBM Future of Computing Research Collaboration (FCRC) is seeking applicants for paid externship opportunities at IBM this summer. Each Visiting Student will work directly with IBM Researchers to accomplish specific research tasks as defined in the project expectations. Visit link for more information.

item.title: Systems Engineering & Technology Management Review Scheduled for February 13
item.description: Date: Thursday, February 13, 2025 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - Hosted by Dean Aric Krause, Ph.D., this session focuses on Rensselaer’s flexible, project-based, online Systems Engineering and Technology Management graduate degree that will help prepare decision-makers with broader and deeper capabilities in leading dynamic organizations. Please register if you plan to attend.
item.author: Community

item.title: CEE Seminar Speaker Series Continues February 12
item.description: Date: Wednesday, February 12, 2025 1:00 PM - 2:00 PM - In a presentation titled “Engineering Ethics and the Flint Water Crisis,” Ms. Elin Betanzo will discuss engineers’ roles in public decision making within the context of the Flint water crisis. Further, through the lens of the ASCE code of ethics and with reference to her extensive technical experience regarding safe drinking water, Elin will discuss ethically challenging scenarios that arise during normal engineering practice.

item.title: Rensselaer at Work Information Session Slated for Feburary 21
item.description:
Friday, February 21, 2025 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - Rensselaer at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph. D., will be reviewing the online, project-based graduate degrees and certificates. Expect to hear details about how RPI Instructor Mentors provide industry expertise, advice, and mentorship in a targeted and experiential learning environment. Please RSVP if you plan to attend and learn more about Rensselaer at Work.
